title: Augusta County: Jedediah Hotchkiss to Nelson H. Hotchkiss, January 4, 1863
summary: Hotchkiss describes his trip back to camp on New Year's Day, when the trains were crowded with hired slaves going to new situations. He also expresses optimism at the way military matters are unfolding in the west.
keywords: Slavery, African Americans, Church/Religious Activity, Military Authority, Agriculture, Camp Life, Women, Family, American Civil War
